item.title: On the subject of porting,
item.description: On this, the first few minutes of Guido’s PyCon Keynote really hit home. Yes you should all be using Python 3, and I know that you all want to, but I know it’s difficult. You all have large amounts of Python 2 code in production that you’ve ported to Python 2.7.9 … but the step to Python 3 from there is still phenomenal. You can’t just fix a few style nets and remove a few L’s from long integers.
